info.title: FileCloud API
info.description: The FileCloud APIs provide developers with the tools necessary to build a variety of apps and clients. This allows extensibility and integration of FileCloud with your existing enterprise systems and frameworks. FileCloud developer API is simple to use and integrate.

get.description: Get all the activity of the file/folder

200.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request, the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: Specify the path for which you want to get the activity list

parameters.name: text

parameters.description: Path of the file where it resides.

In a POST request, the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path Name to be specified, If the user wants to access MyFiles then use the username as path.

parameters.name: sortdir
parameters.description: Set it to 1 for ascending sort , -1 for descending sort

parameters.name: sortby
parameters.description: You can sort by name, date or size.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start index of records to retrieve, Note: Index starts from 0. Default 0

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Set to any number of record you want to view at once. Default 10

In a POST request, the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

post.description: User can search for a file/folder

200.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request, the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Specify the directory path in which you want to perform search.

parameters.name: minsize
parameters.description: (optional)Specify the size in kb, the search will show files that is greater than and equal to the size mentioned.

parameters.name: maxsize
parameters.description: (optional)Specify the size in kb, the search will show files that is lesser than and equal to the size mentioned.

parameters.name: modifiedstart
parameters.description: (optional)Specify the value in date format, the search will show files that was created on and after the date mentioned

parameters.name: modifiedend
parameters.description: (optional)Specify the value in date format, the search will show files that was created before the date mentioned

post.description: User can perform context search for a file/folder. It is mandatory to either specify searchname or searchtext to perform this search.

200.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request, the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

parameters.name: searchname
parameters.description: Specify the filename to be searched.

parameters.name: searchloc
parameters.description: (optional) Specify the directory path in which you want to perform search (if not specified user's home directory will be the path)

parameters.name: minsize
parameters.description: (optional)Specify the size in kb, the search will show files that is greater than and equal to the size mentioned.

parameters.name: maxsize
parameters.description: (optional)Specify the size in kb, the search will show files that is lesser than and equal to the size mentioned.

parameters.name: modifiedstart
parameters.description: (optional)Specify the value in date format, the search will show files that was created on and after the date mentioned

parameters.name: modifiedend
parameters.description: (optional)Specify the value in date format, the search will show files that was created before the date mentioned

200.description: Returns an object with multiple fields.
